text:
What's up everyone! Today we are learning 
alternatives to I think. Now although I

think it's not necessarily bad to use it can 
be great compared to some other alternatives,

sometimes it's good to have more options and 
to be more specific with what you want to say.

So we're going to learn some of those alternatives 
today but before we get into it and in case you're

new here I want to let you know that we help 
you to learn fast English without getting lost,

without missing the jokes and without subtitles. 
Just like this fan who says that our channel is

the best because of the way that we explain 
and give examples. So be sure to hit that

subscribe button and the bell down below so 
that you don't miss any of our new lessons!

Do you struggle to understand fast speaking 
natives? Then I highly recommend our Fluent with

Friends course. In this 48 week course you'll 
learn with the first two seasons of Friends!

you'll receive PDF Power Lessons every week, 
vocabulary memorization software, access to

our Fluency Circle Global Community and so much 
more! And did you know you can try it right now

for free with our three-part Masterclass! All 
you have to do is pick up here or down in the

description box below to learn more and sign 
up now! We look forward to seeing you there!

If you enjoy learning a variety of vocabulary then 
I highly recommend this lesson that I made on our

RealLife English Channel where you can learn 
more than 55 phrases for daily conversation.

You can click up here or down in the 
description box below to watch that lesson next!

So the first phrases that we're going to have a 
look at are how to ask someone how they are. So

you've probably learned that you would say how 
are you and while we do still use this natives

use a lot of other expressions a lot of other 
phrases to ask this question so the first one is.
